channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Very large trees overhanding and dropping branches, 4th January
item.description:
Good morning, Yesterday i reported an issue with blocked road side drains and water flooding down our side road to 'Sheepshead Row' now called 'leckhmapton Lodge'. Please also note, the trees on the main road, also coming down our drive (this is also public highway and IS NOT a private road) are hugely overgrown and branches keep falling on the road which have to be moved. The used to be cut regularly, however, haven't been for some 3/4 years now and are dangerous. The road, leading to Field Cottage is also a public footpath which bring with it a danger to life when windy.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The cover of a plastic illuminated square-section 'Keep Left' bollard on island in middle of road has become detached from its base and is lying on the island – either struck by a vehicle, blown over by wind or vandalised., 4th January
item.description:
Island in middle of road in front of 123 The Park, Cheltenham GL50 2RG (near junction of The Park and Tivoli Road). What3Words exact location: guides.glove.pages. Seen today, 3rd Jan 2024.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Merestones Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Bollard cover is off but not causing a trip hazard/obstruction

item.title: Builders putting cones out on road to reserve spaces for their vans on a public road., 3rd January
item.description:
Cones being put out preventing residents from parking in permitted zones. Cones are being put into public highway to reserve spaces for multiple trades vans doing work at a house on the road which is causing nuisance.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Andover Street, Tivoli, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wide area breaking up, 3rd January
item.description:
There is a wide area that’s breaking up just as you go round the bend from the old Bath road into Charlton lane/Greenhills road. It’s getting worse daily especially when it rains. Dangerous. Just going round the corner as people may swerve to avoid it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 83, Charlton Lane, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There are at least 11 portholes along this lane from just b4 blacklains farm past gower house up to longdole polo most are very deep and can cause damage. 1 has blown my suspension. Thus road is constantly beenong patched up. The one in question is just oast gower house but b4 the water reservoir., 3rd January
item.description:
As above. But been there for months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cotswold

item.title: New surface, laid 2 weeks ago, has already been washed out by water running down the hill, 3rd January
item.description:
On the recently laid and widened bridlepath from Crippetts Lane towards Greenway Lane. The granite ‘dust’ has already been washed away in places - and the kerb drains are full of granite dust and can’t work. Not sure if this is a design issue - not coping with the level of water, or a construction issue. Sad to think that the money and time spent on this has only lasted 2 weeks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crippetts Lane, Leckhampton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water egress from drain whenever it rains leads to A435 flooding 200 metres to north., 3rd January
item.description:
Location A435 approx 100 metres north of junction with Malleson Road. Whenever it rains water pours from this drain leading to shallow flood in the dip 200 metres north on the A435 where there is a culvert. Especially dangerous in frosty conditions as salt is washed away and the road is covered by black ice. Persistent problem since resurfacing of road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
